metadata.title: CVE-2018-1139 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way samba before 4.7.9 and 4.8.4 allowed the use ofweak NTLMv1 authentication even when NTLMv1 was explicitly disabled. Aman-in-the-middle attacker could use this flaw to read the credential andother details passed between the samba server and client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.2').
